name: Richard Silverton
summary:
I'm a full-stack developer with almost 10 years experience working with web technologies, focused on the front end. I consider myself an expert in Javascript, Typescript, React, CSS and browser APIs, but I also have significant experience with Python, Rust, React Native, MongoDB, RethinkDB, Webpack, Bash, Git and Docker.

I love working with new technologies and experimenting with cutting-edge browser features, but I'm equally passionate about thinking through architectural decisions and using my experience to ensure any production code base that I work on is not only bug-free, but designed to be as reslient as possible to the introduction of bugs. Whilst I'm not from a strongly-typed CS background, I enjoy working with type systems and appreciate the way they focus my attention on the structure of data as well as code.

In more sociable times, I was a co-organiser of the London Meteor meetup, at which I've presented on a multitude of occasions (1)(2)(3), speaking about all aspects of full-stack development, and demonstrating a series of personal projects.

1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v-yPPPjCk_I2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rWcXAhUkp6Y3: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O15hAIsncO8

employmentHistory.description:
I lead front-end development for an artificial intelligence startup, which utilises cutting-edge NLP to deliver analytics and automation over large collections of emails and chat data. I lead a small team of experienced engineers who are responsible for building and maintaining our complex web app, making architectural decisions and managing the feature development process alongside a product manager, but a lot of my role is hands-on development and code review.

The app provides a sophisticated interface that allows non-technical users to train cutting-edge machine learning models, validate their results, see detailed analysis of the data, and set up automations. It's written in Typescript, React, Redux and Material-UI, with an API service written in Python to which I also contribute.

Working as part of a boutique agency, I built complex web and native applications from the ground up for clients across a range of industries, from startups to major international corporations. Technologies included React, Redux, MongoDB, Meteor.js, Node, Express and Ansible.

I was responsible for delivering the financial analysis component of the organisation's bids for the Ministry of Justice's ground-breaking Transforming Rehabilitation initiative. I reported directly to the charity's board and the MoJ on all financial aspects of the process.

After deciding to leave trading to become a developer, I spent around a year intensively teaching myself Python and Javascript via online resources including Udacity and Coursera.  I put these skills to work by developing sites for my running club's racing league, a fantasy biathlon game which was internationally popular and mentioned on TV, a successful e-commerce site and an annual charity football event, amongst other personal projects.

employmentHistory.role: Vice president, Short-term interest rates trading
employmentHistory.description: I was responsible for market-making and discretionary trading of international interest rate products and foreign exchange to manage credit, market and funding risks. I also provided market intelligence and personal trading views to high-profile clients including central banks.
I developed a flexible CDO pricing model which could be calibrated to prevailing market correlations in Matlab.
